noun.description: A sudden, violent, irregular movement of a limb or of the body, caused by involuntary contraction of muscles and associated especially with brain disorders such as epilepsy, the presence of certain toxins or other agents in the blood, or fever in children.
A violent social or political upheaval.

origin: Mid 16th century (originally in the sense cramp, spasm): from Latin convulsio(n-), from the verb convellere (see convulse).
